title: Lots of hard links to doc.perl6.org
body:
Almost all of these have to be changed.

```
grep -R 'doc.perl6.org' *
```

```
Language/5to6-perlvar.pod:I'm taking my information from L<http://doc.perl6.org/language/variables>
Language/5to6-perlvar.pod:L<http://doc.perl6.org/language/variables#The_%5E_Twigil>
Language/5to6-perlvar.pod:=item L<http://doc.perl6.org/routine/%5B%20%5D#language_documentation_Operators>
Language/5to6-perlvar.pod:=item L<http://doc.perl6.org/type/Whatever>
Language/5to6-perlsyn.pod:I'm taking my information from L<http://doc.perl6.org> (in particular,
Language/5to6-perlsyn.pod:L<http://doc.perl6.org/language/syntax> and
Language/5to6-perlsyn.pod:L<http://doc.perl6.org/language/control>), supplemented by the design
Language/5to6-perlsyn.pod:L<http://doc.perl6.org/language/control#given>.
Language/5to6-perlsyn.pod:L<http://doc.perl6.org/language/control#given>.
Language/glossary.pod:L<http://doc.perl6.org/type/Junction>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:I'm taking my information from L<https://doc.perl6.org>, supplemented by the
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/type/IO::Path#File_Test_operators>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/io>. Also, the section on C<open()>
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:(L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/control#proceed_and_succeed>).
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:See L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/exceptions>. To omit the stacktrace
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/5to6-nutshell#Importing_specific_functions_from_a_module>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/regexes#Adverbs>
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:deals with newlines. Details at L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/open>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/unpack>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/regexes#Continue>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/quoting>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:see L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/operators#prefix_%5E> and
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/pick>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:take a look at L<https://doc.perl6.org/type/IO::Path#routine_dir>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:see L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/io>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:details, see L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/regexes#Adverbs>
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/sort> for details. May also be used as a
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:are at L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/split>. Unsurprisingly, C<split>
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/functions>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:For this, you probably want C<run> (L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/run>)
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:or C<shell> (L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/shell>).
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:does what you need here. L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/tc>
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/routine/unpack>.
Language/5to6-perlfunc.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/exceptions>.
Language/about.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org>.
Language/performance.pod:Use the C<m: your code goes here> L<#perl6 channel evalbot|http://doc.perl6.org/language/glossary#camelia>
Language/performance.pod:Enter C<prof-m: your code goes here> in the L<#perl6 channel|http://doc.perl6.org/language/glossary#IRC>
Language/performance.pod:others using the L<#perl6|http://doc.perl6.org/language/glossary#IRC> evalbot
Language/performance.pod:L<camelia|http://doc.perl6.org/language/glossary#camelia>.
Language/5to6-perlop.pod:I'm taking my information from L<https://doc.perl6.org> (in particular,
Language/5to6-perlop.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/operators>), supplemented by the
Language/5to6-perlop.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/operators#Operator_Precedence>.
Language/5to6-perlop.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/terms#Pair>.
Language/5to6-perlop.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/operators#infix_%3A>.
Language/5to6-perlop.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/quoting>.
Language/5to6-perlop.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/quoting#Interpolation%3A_qq>.
Language/5to6-perlop.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/language/io>.
Language/faq.pod:L<https://doc.perl6.org/|https://doc.perl6.org/> as the canonical technical reference.
Language/faq.pod:Yes, see L<glossary|https://doc.perl6.org/language/glossary>.
Language/faq.pod:See the pod with the 5to6- prefix under L<https://doc.perl6.org/language.html|https://doc.perl6.org/language.html>
Language/io.pod:TODO: http://doc.perl6.org/type/IO::Handle has close but no open
```
